page.title: 17CUSTOMS
page.content: In 1977 to celebrate the Royal Jubilee it was decided to hold a teaparty and sports day for all the Parish. Money raising schemes were organised to pay for the food and prizes. This was a great success and as there was some money left over the villages repeated the event in the following year. One of the Church Holy days is on the Feast of St. Peter and St. Paul on 29th June and traditionally it had been called "Thornton Feast". It was decided to hold the Sports on the nearest Saturday to this date every year. Everybody has a great time running races and taking part in all the events such as Lucky Dip, Treasure Hunt, Tug-of-war, Slippery Pole, Trampoline, Decorated Bicycle, B.M.X. bicycle course and Pram Race. The ladies provide home-made sandwiches and cakes for all.
